title: How to build my own 3D printing kit - Quora

response.answer_text: Basically, choose one, buy it, and assemble it. Another answer here suggested going from the ground up, but I think you would do better an actual kit that comes complete with all parts. There are some good ones that are made out of extruded aluminum and bolt together like an erector set that are a good value and easy to put together. For about half that, you could get an Anet A8, which is a “real” kit of parts that will require a bit more actual assembly. I suggest the A8 with some caution since they have burned down a few houses. But with proper attention to detail in the construction, and a precautionary change to its firmware to turn on some disabled safety features, that shouldn’t be a problem. Some of those extruded aluminum kits had the same disabled-the-safety-settings issue. Also, you don’t have to buy a kit. There are some low cost fully assembled 3d printers out there that get decent reviews. They might have a small unheated bed, but if you get to the point where that’s an issue—You’ll know exactly what you want in your next printer.

Basically we know 3D printing is any of various processes in which material is joined or solidified under computer control to create a three-dimensional object. Are you want to build 3D printing kit?
